emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Full Stack Development
emerging_technologies.description: AI systems capable of autonomously designing, coding, testing, and deploying complex software applications.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduces the barrier to entry for software development, potentially increasing software ubiquity and innovation but raising concerns about job displacement.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: High initial costs, need for trust in AI reliability, regulatory acceptance, and the evolution of developer roles into oversight and quality assurance.

emerging_technologies.name: Neuralink-like Brain-Computer Interfaces
emerging_technologies.description: Implantable brain-computer interfaces that allow for direct communication between the brain and digital devices.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Potential for enhancing human capabilities, treating neurological disorders, but ethical concerns about privacy, consent, and enhancement inequality.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Regulatory approval, safety concerns, public perception, and the development of non-invasive alternatives.

emerging_technologies.name: Quantum-Resistant Blockchain
emerging_technologies.description: Blockchain technologies that are resistant to attacks from quantum computers, ensuring long-term security.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Enhances trust in digital transactions, crucial for the longevity of digital economies.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Transition cost, standardization, integration with existing systems, and the pace of quantum computing advancement.

emerging_technologies.name: AI-Powered Urban Planning
emerging_technologies.description: AI systems for optimizing urban spaces for sustainability, efficiency, and livability through real-time data analysis.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Promotes sustainable urban growth but might face resistance due to privacy concerns and loss of human control in planning.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Need for extensive data collection, acceptance by urban planners, integration with existing infrastructure, and regulatory frameworks.

mainstream_technologies.name: Autonomous Electric Vehicles
mainstream_technologies.description: Vehicles that operate autonomously with zero emissions, integrating into smart city infrastructure.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widespread adoption in urban areas with necessary regulatory and infrastructural support.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI-Enhanced Cybersecurity
mainstream_technologies.description: Use of AI to predict, prevent, and respond to cyber threats in real-time.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Becoming standard in both private and public sectors due to increased digital threats.

epoch_themes.description: AI becoming an integral part of everyday activities, enhancing efficiency and personalization.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Increased automation could lead to job displacement but also to new job categories in AI oversight and development.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Global push for ethical AI development, standardization, and regulation to address privacy, security, and employment issues.

epoch_themes.description: Advancements in technology that directly enhance or interface with human cognitive and physical capabilities.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Potential for significant medical breakthroughs but also raises ethical questions about the nature of human enhancement and privacy.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increasing interest in bioethics, with regulations and public discourse focusing on the implications of human augmentation.
